postsData.content:
The Rise of Portable LLMs: AI Anywhere, Anytime

Large Language Models (LLMs) are transforming industries, but their size and complexity often limit accessibility. portable LLMs‚Äîlightweight, optimised versions designed to run on local devices like smartphones and laptops, bringing AI to the edge.

Why Portable LLMs Matter
1. Accessibility: Enables AI in regions with limited internet.
2. Privacy: Keeps sensitive data on-device, ideal for healthcare and finance.
3. Cost Efficiency: Reduces reliance on expensive cloud infrastructure.
4. Real-Time Performance: Eliminates latency for instant applications.
5. Sustainability: Lowers energy consumption compared to cloud-based models.

Use Cases
- Healthcare: On-device patient data analysis.
- Education: Offline tutoring and content creation.
- Customer Support: Instant, localised AI support.
- Creative Work: Brainstorming and editing offline.

Challenges
Optimising portable LLMs for limited hardware requires advancements in model compression and quantisation. Balancing performance and size remains a key focus.

The Future
Portable LLMs are making AI more practical, accessible, and secure. As they evolve, they‚Äôll unlock new possibilities, empowering users to harness AI anywhere, anytime.

The future of AI isn‚Äôt just in the cloud‚Äîit‚Äôs in your pocket.
postsData.commentAdded: Exciting times ahead with portable LLMs! They truly democratize AI access, enhancing privacy and performance. Cant wait to see how they evolve!

postsData.content:
To be upright means to have high moral integrity and resistance to temptation or corruption. On the other hand, to be uptight means to be rigid, anxious, and overly strict, adhering to rules without considering time, place, and circumstances. The Bhagavad Gita (16.1), while listing the qualities that comprise a godly nature, emphasizes that such individuals are gentle yet steady in their convictions‚Äîthey are upright without being uptight.

When we are gentle in our dealings, we speak softly and affectionately, conducting ourselves in a way that is graceful and pleasing, or at least non-agitating, to others. Life can be hard and sometimes harsh, filled with challenges that require us to be resilient. When we encounter adversities or even atrocities, life‚Äôs harshness can feel overwhelming, especially when surrounded by others who are also hard and harsh. In such times, encountering just one gentle person can provide immense relief and joy.

postsData.commentAdded: Beautifully said! Embracing gentleness while staying steadfast in our values can transform our interactions and uplift those around us.

This startup wants to solve the climate crisis by repairing our roads.


Roads are probably the biggest infrastructure on the planet.

Spread across millions of kilometers.

But we don‚Äôt think a lot about them.

Especially in the context of climate change.

Norwegian startupis changing that.

Most roads are filled with bitumen.

It‚Äôs an adhesive that keeps asphalt in place.

Bitumen is a sticky form of crude oil.

Which comes from fossil fuels.

Fossil fuels release carbon.

And are responsible for the climate crisis.

Carbon Crusher is replacing bitumen.

With an adhesive that stores carbon inside it.

Instead of releasing it.

To make this adhesive, it uses:

1Ô∏è‚É£ A byproduct biopolymer from the paper industry, which is carbon intensive.
2Ô∏è‚É£ Biochar, made from biomass waste, such as wood or agricultural waste.
3Ô∏è‚É£ Volcanic rocks.

Once the adhesive is ready, it uses the Carbon Crusher.

It‚Äôs a heavy-duty crushing machine.

That breaks up the top layer of roads.

That needs repairing.

After that, Carbon Crusher glues the crushed material together.

Using its carbon-storing adhesive.

This eliminates the need to transport new materials.

And dispose off the existing ones.

postsData.name:
Md Jubair Ahmed
Md Jubair Ahmed
postsData.content:
Nvidia called DeepSeek‚Äôs R1 model ‚Äúan excellent AI advancement,‚Äù despite the stock price to plunge 17%

I ran the deepseek R1 on-prem, ran eval and benchmarking to find out firsthand what's really going on. Also read all of their published research papers.

Here is what I found.

Tl;DR: I found ingenuity, innovation and true performance. Also found the fact that it Achieved expert-level performance in coding competitions, outperforming most human participants on platforms like Codeforces.

DeepSeek-V3 Development

Scaling and Architecture

Built as a Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) model with 671 billion parameters, activating 37 billion per token.

Introduced Multi-Head Latent Attention (MLA) for efficient inference and auxiliary-loss-free load balancing to enhance training stability and performance.

Implemented a Multi-Token Prediction (MTP) objective to improve data efficiency and speculative decoding capabilities.

Training Innovations

Used FP8 mixed precision training for reduced memory usage and faster computation.

Developed the Dual Pipe algorithm for overlapping computation and communication during training, minimizing bottlenecks.

Pre-trained on 14.8 trillion high-quality tokens, focusing on diverse multilingual data, with enhanced ratios of math and programming samples.

Post-Training Enhancements

Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT) and Reinforcement Learning (RL) aligned the model with human preferences.

Distilled reasoning capabilities from DeepSeek-R1 to improve reasoning tasks like mathematics and coding.

Capabilities

Achieves state-of-the-art performance in open-source models for math, coding, and multilingual benchmarks.

Comparable to closed-source models like GPT-4o and Claude-3.5 in many areas, outperforming them in some Chinese language tasks.

Benchmark Performance

Outperformed LLaMA-3.1 (405B dense) and Qwen2.5 (72B dense) in most benchmarks despite fewer activated parameters.

Excelled in math (e.g., MATH: 61.6%) and coding tasks (e.g., HumanEval Pass@1: 65.2%).

DeepSeek-R1 Development

Initial Model: DeepSeek-R1-Zero

Trained purely via Reinforcement Learning (RL) without supervised fine-tuning.

Emerged with advanced reasoning behaviors like self-verification and reflection but faced issues like poor readability.

Enhanced Model: DeepSeek-R1

Incorporated "cold-start" fine-tuning with curated long Chain-of-Thought (CoT) data to improve readability and accelerate convergence.

Applied reasoning-oriented RL with rewards for accuracy and language consistency to refine reasoning capabilities.

Distillation Process

Distilled reasoning patterns into smaller dense models (e.g., Qwen-32B), enabling high performance in compact architectures.

Capabilities

Matches or surpasses OpenAI's o1 series in key reasoning tasks like AIME 2024 (Pass@1: 79.8%) and MATH-500 (97.3%).

Achieved expert-level performance in coding competitions, outperforming most human participants on platforms like Codeforces

comments.commentText: It's great to see models being evaluated on both open-source and closed-source benchmarks. Comprehensive!

postsData.commentAdded: Impressive insights! DeepSeeks advancements truly push the boundaries of AI, showcasing remarkable performance in innovation and coding challenges. üöÄ #AI

Exciting New Cars in 2025: The Future of Driving

2025 marks a new era for the automotive industry, with incredible innovations and exciting new models hitting the streets. From electric vehicles (EVs) to cutting-edge autonomous technology, the future of driving is taking shape right before our eyes. Let‚Äôs dive into some of the most anticipated cars arriving in 2025!

1. The Rise of Electric Vehicles (EVs)

With a global push towards sustainability, EVs are becoming the norm rather than the exception. Brands like Tesla, Rivian, and Ford are launching new models that promise longer ranges, faster charging, and even more advanced self-driving capabilities. Whether it's the Tesla Cybertruck or the Ford Mustang Mach-E 2025, these cars are ready to redefine the driving experience.

Autonomous driving technology continues to make incredible strides. Companies like Waymo and General Motors are improving their self-driving systems, bringing us closer to fully autonomous vehicles. Expect to see more cars on the road that can drive themselves, handle complex traffic scenarios, and provide safer and more convenient commutes.

Sustainability isn‚Äôt just about emissions ‚Äì it‚Äôs also about the materials used in building the cars. In 2025, expect more vehicles made from recycled or eco-friendly materials, contributing to a greener and more sustainable planet.

Some iconic brands are making a comeback in 2025, with revamped designs and the latest technology. The 2025 Ford Bronco and the Chevrolet Corvette E-Ray (an electric hybrid) are among the most talked-about models. These cars combine nostalgia with futuristic tech, offering something for every type of driver.

From AI-powered assistants to advanced infotainment systems, the cabins of 2025 vehicles will feel like your personal mobile office or entertainment hub. Expect seamless connectivity, voice-activated controls, and perhaps even in-car virtual assistants that learn from your preferences.

It‚Äôs an exciting time for the industry, but I often hear one question: ùôíùôûùô°ùô° ùô©ùôßùôñùôôùôûùô©ùôûùô§ùô£ùôñùô° ùô¢ùô§ùôôùôöùô°ùô® ùô°ùôûùô†ùôö ùôîùôäùôáùôä ùôñùô£ùôô ùòøùôÄùôèùôç ùôóùôöùôòùô§ùô¢ùôö ùô§ùôóùô®ùô§ùô°ùôöùô©ùôö?

Why YOLO and DETR Are Still Critical:

Having built companies in this space, I‚Äôve seen firsthand the unique role that vision-specific models like YOLO and DETR play. They are:

Specialized: These models are optimized for tasks like object detection and segmentation, delivering efficiency and speed unmatched by the more resource-intensive multimodal systems.

Edge-Ready: For applications like drones, autonomous vehicles, and IoT devices, their lightweight architecture makes them indispensable.

Foundational: Even LLM-powered systems rely on models like YOLO or DETR to extract meaningful embeddings before adding reasoning or context.

At, we leverage these models to provide efficient, real-time solutions for industries like manufacturing, retail, and healthcare. Our platform integrates YOLO/DETR with modern compute orchestration, offering the best of both worlds.

ùó™ùóµùóÆùòÅ‚ÄôùòÄ ùóñùóµùóÆùóªùó¥ùó∂ùóªùó¥ ùó∂ùóª ùòÅùóµùó≤ ùó©ùó∂ùòÄùó∂ùóºùóª ùóüùóÆùóªùó±ùòÄùó∞ùóÆùóΩùó≤?

While YOLO and DETR remain vital, LLMs are pushing computer vision into new territory:

Contextual Intelligence: LLMs add reasoning to vision outputs, enabling use cases like hazard detection in factories or quality analysis in manufacturing.

Semantic Search: By combining vision embeddings with language understanding, we can now search for concepts like ‚Äúred cars in sunny landscapes.‚Äù

End-to-End Multimodal Systems: Models like GPT-4 Vision and SAM (Segment Anything Model) demonstrate how vision tasks can integrate seamlessly with text, audio, and video.

ùóîùó±ùóÆùóΩùòÅùóÆùòÅùó∂ùóºùóª, ùó°ùóºùòÅ ùóòùòÖùòÅùó∂ùóªùó∞ùòÅùó∂ùóºùóª

As someone deeply involved in this field, I see this less as a battle and more as a collaboration. Models like YOLO and DETR aren‚Äôt being replaced; they‚Äôre adapting and becoming integral parts of larger multimodal pipelines.

Looking Ahead:

The convergence of LLMs and traditional vision models is where the real innovation lies. We‚Äôre entering an era where vision models provide the speed and precision while LLMs add reasoning and contextualization. This synergy will open doors to entirely new possibilities in automation, analytics, and decision-making.

postsData.content:
Cold outreach isn‚Äôt dead. Your cold outreach just sucks.

Most people think cold outreach is outdated. That nobody responds anymore. That it‚Äôs not worth the effort.

But let‚Äôs be real ‚Äì cold outreach isn‚Äôt the problem. Bad cold outreach is.

You know the type:
‚Ä¢ A long, copy-paste pitch with zero personalization
‚Ä¢ A cold email that reads like ChatGPT on low power mode
‚Ä¢ A message that makes it all about them and nothing about you

No wonder it gets ignored.

But when done right? Cold outreach is still the most powerful way to:
‚Ä¢ Land your dream job
‚Ä¢ Connect with a mentor
‚Ä¢ Acquire that next client
‚Ä¢ Build real relationships with people 10 steps ahead of you

And the best part? It works for anyone, at any stage.

Here‚Äôs how to do it right:
1Ô∏è‚É£ Find common ground. Did you go to the same school? Follow the same people? Work in a similar industry? Shared experiences build instant trust.
2Ô∏è‚É£ Personalize it. Show you actually know who they are and why you‚Äôre reaching out. Mention something specific they‚Äôve done that resonated with you.
3Ô∏è‚É£ Lead with value. Acknowledge their work, ask a smart question, or offer something useful.
4Ô∏è‚É£ Make it easy to respond. No life stories. No paragraphs. Just a clear, simple ask.

Most people won‚Äôt do this.
They‚Äôll keep sending spam.
They‚Äôll keep getting ignored.

But the ones who take five extra minutes to craft a thoughtful message?
They‚Äôll get in the room with the people who can change their lives.

Shoot me your cold outreach success stories in the comments

postsData.content:
Google's Titans: A New Era in Neural Memory and Long-Term Context Handling

 Overview: Google Research has introduced "Titans," a new family of deep learning architectures designed to address the memory limitations of current attention-based and recurrent models like Transformers. Titans utilize a novel neural memory module that mimics human long-term memory by learning to memorize historical context at test time. Unlike Transformers, which rely on a fixed context window, Titans can scale to over 2M tokens, maintaining high performance in complex reasoning and sequence modeling tasks.

 Key Features:
‚ñ∂Ô∏èTitans integrate short-term memory (attention) and long-term neural memory to handle large contexts efficiently.
‚ñ∂Ô∏èThey outperform state-of-the-art models, including Transformers and recurrent variants, across tasks like language modeling, commonsense reasoning, and genomic data analysis.
‚ñ∂Ô∏èThe architecture introduces three variants: 1Ô∏è‚É£ Memory-as-Context (MAC) 2Ô∏è‚É£ Memory-as-Gating (MAG) 3Ô∏è‚É£ Memory-as-Layer (MAL)
‚ñ∂Ô∏èResults highlight significant improvements in tasks requiring needle-in-haystack retrieval, reasoning over extremely long sequences, and time series forecasting.

‚Äç For AI practitioners, Titans signal a shift in focus from fixed-window Transformers to architectures that combine deep, dynamic memory systems. Adopting models like Titans can enhance performance in applications with extensive historical dependencies, such as genomics, natural language understanding, and time-series forecasting.

 Source:

 Visit my blog for weekly updates:
